property.name: text
property.value: Look inside the ModalModel to see how this is implemented.

svg.text:
This hybrid system models an apparatus called Newton's cradle with 3 balls suspended by strings.
The parameters on the left specify the sizes of the balls and their initial states. The m* parameters specify the masses of balls and the k* parameters specify the restitution coefficients (RC).
In this model, we set all masses to be the same and the RC of the collision between ball #1 and #2 as k1 and RC of the collision between ball #2 and #3 as k4. Because of the selections of the RC's, three balls eventually move together.
This class defines the dynamics of a pendulum.

When any two adjacent balls have contact and their relative velocity is bigger than 0.0, they collide. The restitution coefficient of collision between ball #1 and #2 is k1 and the restitution coefficient of collision between ball #2 and #3 is k4. (You may try different coeffcients.)
The equations for calculating the velocities of two balls after a collision is the following, where v1 and v2 are the velocities before the collision, and v1' and v2' are the velocities after the collision.
v1' = ((m1-k*m2)*v1 + m2*(1+k)*v2)/(m1+m2) v2' = (m1*(1+k)*v1 + (m2-k*m1)*v2)/(m1+m2)

property.name: setActions
